title: Georgia Open Records Act Request – January 17, 2024 Arrest of Tyree Chapman (Fleeing, Trash Can Arrest)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

copies of all video and audio recordings related to the arrest of Tyree Chapman on January 17, 2024, by the Atlanta Police Department and associated agencies.

Specifically, I request:

All body-worn camera footage from officers who pursued, located, or arrested Mr. Chapman.

All dashcam/in-car video footage related to this incident.

All video from the Aviation Unit (helicopter footage) showing Chapman’s vehicle, foot pursuit, and arrest.

Any surveillance or third-party footage reviewed or collected by APD.

Any 911 calls, dispatch audio, or radio communications related to the incident.

Identifying Details:

Name of Arrestee: Tyree Chapman

Date: January 17, 2024

Time: Approx. 3:37 PM to 4:00 PM EST (as shown in timestamped bodycam and aviation unit footage)

Initial Location: 300 block of Boulevard NE, Atlanta, GA

Vehicle Involved: Stolen Infiniti Q50 (black)

Pursuit Path: From Chevron gas station to Glenn Street SW and adjoining residential area

Arrest Location: In a trash can in a suburban neighborhood near the 300 block of Glenn Street SW

Charges: Fleeing to elude, reckless driving, firearm possession during felony, theft by receiving, and driving on suspended/revoked license

Notable Footage: Bodycam and aerial footage show Chapman hiding in a trash can; a handgun was found in a separate trash can nearby.

Please inform me of any fees prior to fulfilling this request. If any part of the materials are exempt from release, please provide the non-exempt portions and cite the applicable exemptions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News
